intro: Decaneurum platylepis, commonly known as the flat-leaved sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and succulent, fleshy leaves that are typically flat or slightly curled. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia and is adapted to thrive in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
